1.content:
It's been about 7 months since the first patient being treated for the shrinking virus was brought to the hospital for study, and while the disease was confirmed to be non-contagious in origin millions of cases were later confirmed. 750,000 people have been reported missing for longer than a period of two weeks according to the latest census, leading Scientist to fear that these individuals have been stepped on, kidnapped or simply lost for all eternity due to small size.

Lets check in on some of these poor souls and see how they're surviving.

1. Teachers- (Elementary, Middle, Jr. High, High School, and College level all different stories)

2. Scientist- Danny Solestine, He's supposed to be investigating the disease, only problem is that he has it too. Danny is too small to use his equipment and must rely on his 23 year old assistant Lisa's help for everything. But as the months have gone by her respect for Danny, much like his size have dwindled to almost nothing as he stands at a height of only one inch tall and is supposed to be her superior. https://c8.alamy.com/comp/HG7A9F/portrai...

3. Former Construction Worker- Thomas Roslee, now a hobo is living on his own after shrinking too small to safely be around humans of normal size. At 5 millimeters tall he's barely half a centimeter tall and tough to spot for most people without visual aide, unless they're looking for bugs that is.

4. Abducted- Sarah Tompkins- After shrinking to one centimeter tall Sarah was kidnapped to be put up for online auction through the dark web, where she is purchased for fun by another woman. Her survival is unlikely.

info.brief_description: People around the world are shrinking to minuscule sizes, how will it affect their jobs?
info.description:
Citizens of the world are shrinking, afflicted by a disease of unknown type and origin. The infected's size ranging between a height of 1 millimeter and 3 inches tall. With 750,000 people currently missing it's impossible to know for sure if these citizens of the world have been abducted, stepped on, or lost by mysterious means. Some scientists suspect that the disease may be progressive, causing the subject to shrink further after a certain period. However, no cases of this happening have been confirmed by scientists.

Follow professionals in their field as they must adapt to a new way of tackling a world bigger than themselves.
